column8: Guy mentions <cite>L'Atalante</cite>, which can be found on the <cite>The Complete Jean Vigo</cite>.
Robert is holding America Lost and Found: The BBS Story while talking about an interaction with Jack Nicholson. Easy Rider is marked here, as the box set doesn't have a spine number.

Wim mentions Le petit soldat, another Godard film, which is not available on Criterion.
Wim picks up the Eclipse Series box set Oshima's Outlaw Sixties. This graph does not currently handle box sets, so I subbed in In the Realm of the Senses.

Harris talks in depth on only a couple movies, and one only sees flashes of the covers he is holding. <cite>Solaris</cite>, <cite>Fanny & Alexander</cite> and <cite>Bicycle Thieves</cite> were identified by sight.

The brothers specifically mention Phantom India, a movie in the Eclipse box set The Documentaries of Louis Malle - My Dinner with André is in its place. They also take the two Aki Kaurismäki eclipse box sets; Proletariat Trilogy, Leningrad Cowboys.
Virgin Spring is here in place of Ingmar Bergman: Four Masterworks.
They pick up Eclipse Series 11: Larisa Shepitko, which is a box set.
Replaced Oshima's 60s with <cite>In the Realm of the Senses</cite>.

Slavoj talks about The Joke, which can be found on Pearls of the Czech New Wave - Valerie and Her Week of Wonders is in its place. He also takes Rossellini's History Films - The Taking of Power by Louis XIV is in its place. He also mentions Fitzcarraldo, Aguirre, the Wrath of God and The Magnificent Ambersons, which are not on Criterion.
Worst Man Cry Ever, Idiot Spanish Busdriver Almost Kills Students, Battle At Kruger, Taxi Driver Interview.
Edgar mentions Wes Anderson's Criterion movies, but says he has them all.
André mentions the box set André Gregory & Wallace Shawn: 3 Films he is in. Wallace cites Claude Chabrol, who is on Criterion.
Michael mentions I Was Born, But..., which appears on the box set Silent Ozu -- Three Family Comedies. He also mentions the Allan King box set The Actuality Dramas of Allan King.
Wow, these guys took a LOT of movies. Unfortunately, it's hard to identify most of them.
Laurie mentions the box set André Gregory & Wallace Shawn: 3 Films.
At the beginning Gaspar is holding an Eclipse Series, When Horror Came to Shochiku.
Sean takes the Eclipse series box set Chantal Akerman in the Seventies. He specifies Claire's Knee as a particularly affecting movie in the Eric Rohmer collection Six Moral Tales.
Asif picks up the Samurai Trilogy, which is represented by the first movie Samurai I: Musashi Miyamoto.
Joachim picks up The Emirgrants/The New Land, which is represented here by the first movie The Emigrants. He exclaims something in German, and I can't identify what movie he is referring to.
Ira mentions I Was Born, But..., which appears on the box set Silent Ozu -- Three Family Comedies.
Louis mentions the Eclipse Series box set Three Popular Films by Jean-Pierre Gorin.
Tim mentions the Allan King box set The Actuality Dramas of Allan King.
Owen mentions the Eclipse Series box set Up All Night with Robert Downey Sr..
Jeff holds the box set America Lost and Found: the BBS Story.
looks for the Eclipse Series box set Maidstone and Other Films by Norman Mailer.

column2: Ethan Hawke and Jonathan Marc Sherman

column8: Tavi takes the Eclipse Series box set Chantal Akerman in the Seventies.

column2: That One Time Five Comics Raided Our Closet

column8: Euzhan picks up the box set Trilogía de Guillermo del Toro. It has been substituted with the three movies it contains. We see her holding John Cassavetes: Five Films and Love Streams but she doesn't mention them.
Terry takes the box set Ingmar Bergman's Cinema.
